dynamic_line.no: Howdy!  You seem new, what brings you here?

responses.text: Can I do anything for you?
How do I join the phyle?
I'm going on my way now.

dynamic_line: I'm a gardener for PrepNet Phyle.  Who are you?

responses.text: I am a beggar who really needs something to eat.
I am just a fellow survivor.
I'm bringing order back to the land.

dynamic_line: This is a PrepNet Phyle orchard.  We were a community of survivalists gathering resources to prepare for climate change, but it left us better prepared for what actually happened than most.

responses.text: Can you give me something to eat then?
Only the insane will prosper, I guess.

dynamic_line: This food has to go back to our core communities.  But maybe we can trade some food for services
You have to earn the right to trade with us.  Plus we created our own currency before the Cataclysm
This is just an outpost, you'd have to find our main camp and currently we don't want you to.

responses.text: I didn't want to join your club anyway.

dynamic_line: Here?  Fruits and berries.  Maybe the occasional piece of farm equipment, but you need crypto coins

responses.text: Crypto coins?  Are you insane, there isn't any global internet now.

dynamic_line: I got introduced to the movement through Mutual Aid Society.  From there it became an all consuming part of my life to prepare for a post consumption world.  It seems to have worked better for us than for many others.
It can get lonely out here between caravans.  But there's plenty of work and my Cyber Mastiffs.  If a horde comes through we hunker down in a nearby shelter if it's too large for us.

We use so-called crypto coins for money here.  They were a pre-Cataclysm attempt to abstract money even further and create electronic cash.  Now it's a joke because we use physical coins.  Barter only gets you so far.  And one day we'll have the Net back up.

dialogue.offer: I've got to maintain the orchard but at nights I work on prepping winter clothes.  Could you find about… 50 fur pelts for me?
dialogue.accepted: Don't forget to tell me when you have them.
dialogue.rejected: It's okay, I can do without them.  Just let me know if you reconsider.
dialogue.advice: There's a lot of places to look.  The entire outdoors is full of wild animals.
dialogue.inquire: How is the search going?  Have you found'em?
dialogue.success: I really appreciate your help.  Don't worry, you won't leave empty-handed.
dialogue.failure: Don't worry about it, it's not that important.

dialogue.offer: Flour would let me break the monotony of fruit and meats.
dialogue.accepted: Thanks for accepting this task.  Otherwise I might kill a stranger for a sandwich.  Just kidding.
dialogue.rejected: Just let me know if you change your mind.
dialogue.advice: Flour is not that hard to find.  I'd look for them in residential areas and professional kitchens or bakeries.
dialogue.success: Thank you for your help.  Here's your reward.
dialogue.failure: It's not a big deal, it isn't that urgent.

dialogue.describe: I need storage for various liquid products when the fruits come in.
dialogue.offer: Every season we produce so much fruit.  Some of it will be turned into juice and some into alcohol.  I need easy containers to load it on the caravan.
dialogue.accepted: Thank you for accepting.  I'm almost out after the last caravan.
dialogue.rejected: I guess I'll have to make stomach waterskins.
dialogue.advice: Gallon jugs are not that rare to find.  They are commonly found in kitchens.
dialogue.inquire: Do you have those jugs now?
dialogue.success: I am grateful for the help you've done.  I have one more task to do.
dialogue.failure: Don't worry about it, it's not that important.

dialogue.describe: We have the ability to manufacture CBMs but lack resources.
dialogue.offer: If you can bring me burnt out CBMs we can recycle them into new ones.
dialogue.accepted: Thank you for accepting.  You're really making yourself useful to the phyle.
dialogue.rejected: These materials are often in dangerous areas.  I understand your decision.
dialogue.advice: Zombie scientists, technicians, shocker zombies.  These are not undertaken lightly.
dialogue.inquire: Do you have those CBMs now?
dialogue.success: I am grateful for the help you've done.  I think we might be able to introduce you to others soon.
dialogue.failure: Don't worry about it, it's not that important.
